comments.text:
The average visitor to trade fairs like this is not going to care that "this is a prototype" and that "the final version will be better". Neither will the average youtube viewer. They're going to see the lag on this and choose to buy something else. 

Oh and please point me to a "prototype" video of the ipad. Apple is very careful about their public image and would never allow a work-in-progress unit to be demoed anywhere. That's sort of﻿ the reason why they own the market.
comments.author: aniym21000

comments.text: It is Archos' responsibility to create positive product perceptions among consumers, not mine. If they don't want negative responses, they shouldn't demo a product that is working this slowly. When somebody types in Archos G9 on youtube, this is the first video that will pop up as it is the earliest and﻿ has the most views. So even if later reviews show it to be a good product, this is still the first one that most people will see.
